Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: JimDKoloa
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 4 nights in April 2012. I had used Trip Advisor to identify this hotel as a top romantic hotel, and was not disappointed. The most impressive part of our stay were the employees. The British receptionist was extremely helpful and attentive to our needs, assisting with dinner reservations, water taxi reservations, and help with sightseeing. Dindo, the night receptionist, morning chef, and much more, was very warm and engaging .... we always looked forward to interacting with him. Nani, the housekeeper, always had out room impeccable following a day of sightseeing. Room 106 was large and comfortable, and the bathroom relatively large by European standards. The bed and pillows could have been a bit softer, but this is an issue of personal taste. The hotel is conveniently located to many places of interest, particularly the Accademia and Guggheim museums. The little morning breakfast room is light and airy, has a flat screen TV for watching a bit of news, and Dindo puts out a delicious spread each and every monining. The hotel is also very secure, as everyone who enters must ring a little doorbell, and be admitted by the receptionist. Overall, this is a wonderful property, and we would return here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, great staff, beautiful rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Lilypik
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Ca'Pagan for two nights on our first trip to Venice. Staff were friendly and knowledgeable and Lorna gave us some great restaurant recommendations and interesting suggestions of places to visit. The room was clean and comfortable and even more beautiful than the pictures suggest. The location was in a quiet but elegant street, but close to major sights. Would thoroughly recommend this hotel and would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Bellissimo!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: paolo d
Reviews.Content: Great place and location! Rooms are perfect and super clean! They know what they do....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place for romantic weekend!”
Reviews.Author: llady_ann
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! Yes, this is the place that makes you to come back. Go there if you want to feel Venice style.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: thomd51
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a beautiful location, nice , spacious rooms, very good and rich breakfast in the morning! Staff very helpfull and polite. I would recommend this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel on Quiet Street”
Reviews.Author: Lee S
Reviews.Content: We had a one night stay in Venice at Ca' Pagan and had a wonderful time. Everyone associated with the hotel was extremely friendly, helpful and knowledgable. The breakfast included eggs cooked to order. The room was relatively large and very elegant (although the bathroom was somewhat cramped which is to be expected in Venice). The Hotel is a very short walk from a waterbus stop and is located on a quiet street, but is a few minutes walk from a wealth of good restaurants and is a 10-15 min. to San Marco Piazza and Basilica. We would have loved to stayed longer and would definitely book this hotel again. From Check-in to check-out we we were were made to feel very welcomed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: JaromÃ­r G
Reviews.Content: My wife and me spent 3 nights at the hotel in November. Everything was perfect - location, room, breakfast. And extraordinary staff! Strongly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, wonderful welcome”
Reviews.Author: Jane_C_T_S
Reviews.Content: A beautiful small hotel, where the staff can't do enough to help you get the most from your stay. Fantastic peaceful central location, and great recommendations of places to visit and eat. The bedroom was stylish, if compact (it's a beautiful old building, so no complaints with the size) and absolutely spotlessly clean. The breakfast if far more than the basic 'continental' you might expect, a mini buffet that delivered everything we could have wanted (and you might expect from a much larger establishment).

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding little hotel..”
Reviews.Author: Camtfk
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent 3 days at the Ca Pagan and it was excellent. The staff were great to us and made us feel right at home. Although the room was a little small it was classy, neat and very comfortable. The breckfast was very good and we will stay again when in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Opulent, peaceful, convenient - my secret (and now yours)!”
Reviews.Author: CadillacJukebox
Reviews.Content: What a combination: fantastic location for Accademia / San Marco, yet a forgotten corner and idyllically tranquil. Great hotel, rooms and really wonderful service. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Romanic”
Reviews.Author: WhileYouCan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very beautiful, has the elegant and cossy feel. Decorated with high quality expensive pieces, great location, very clean. The staff was amazing, very attentive, full of local knowledge and very helpful, especially the English lady at reception, Lorna. I'm very fussy when it comes to accommodation but this place is 11 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: walkabout101
Reviews.Content: Staff were excellent, especially Lorna. Good location, nice and quiet, but still can walk to everything. Room was tiny, but cozy, "interesting" decor. Bed comfort wasn't up to my standards, but had the same complaint in other Italian hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet oasis in Venice”
Reviews.Author: kjhk
Reviews.Content: Our room was beautiful and very Venetian. I think it was called the Chipendale and decorated in Blue and Gold. Lorna, the receptionist was fantastic and if you follow her instructions they will lead you right to the hotel. Dindo, in the breakfast room, was most helpful and made excellent cappuchino's! He had our breakfast ready early on the day we departed. Venice is very expensive but we were pleased with this hotel and were glad that it was not in a busy area like the Rialto. Would not hesitate to reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location away from the tourist crowds”
Reviews.Author: Hoopersville Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location in a residential area 15 minutes from St Marks Square. Room was recently renovated, but quite dark. The black gold gilded wall paper and dark furnishings were too heavy for the small room that had little natural light. All rooms were different and I think that other rooms may have had brighter decor. Â Staff were very friendly and helpful and really made this place very special.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay.Wonderful value.”
Reviews.Author: themisb
Reviews.Content: Excellent quiet hotel in a wonderful backstreet location away from the crowds. Very helpful staff. Good value for money in venice. Bed and room comfortable, Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Venetian weekend”
Reviews.Author: TreetopsCobham
Reviews.Content: This hotel proved to be a lovely place for a long weekend in Venice. It was conveniently located in the San Marco area. The staff were very helpful with suggestions for eating and sightseeing that proved to be very insightful. The room was well decorated with some lovely antique furniture. Breakfast in the courtyard was a lovely way to start the day. In all, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, a few quirks.”
Reviews.Author: MikeyBirch
Reviews.Content: Hotel was excellently located just off from San Samuele water bus stop which makes it easy to reach. A few yards from San Stefano piazza with good amenities and 10 mins to San Marco. Stayed in a deluxe room, nice mezzanine layout, though bathroom cramped. Overall a good place, and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Gem !”
Reviews.Author: shazza0781
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 3 day break in Venice, the welcome, service, location and staff were superb. Lorna the manager deserves a special mention, nothing was too much trouble for her, she pointed out the best places to visit, restaurants and even called ahead to one restaurant to make sure they explained the menu us (menu totally in Italian) ! We hope to visit again and will recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect small hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: CMAB31
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the beginning of our honeymoon and we were made very welcome with a lovely bottle of Prosecco to celebrate. The room was charmingly decorated in the Venetian style with a modern well appointed bathroom. The location was very convenient on a quiet street but close to the vaporetto stop on the Grand Canal. The staff were very helpful in suggesting the key places to visit, entertainment and restaurants. We would really recommend the "Musica a Palazzo" opera evening.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST HOTEL IN VENICE”
Reviews.Author: shilohzara46
Reviews.Content: If you are still looking for a place to stay in Venice, look no more. Ca' Pagan has the best location, best staff and best owners ever. We stayed here for our 7th year Wedding Anniversary. As soon as we get there we were welcomed by Lorna who can be the best tour guide, she showed us map of Venezia and point out the places that we need to see (I even bought a book that I read for 5days, memorize important locations). We were also greeted by the owners who are very down to earth. We stayed at the GOLD ROOM and OMG it is SO CLEAN and you can really feel that you are in Venice.... they say they are 4 star hotel, this hotel should be a 5 Star hotel... One of their staff members is Dindo. He was always there when we need help and pay attention to details, friendly and hardworking. We will for sure be back and will be staying at Ca' Pagan again =)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a superb,convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: DDDMEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ca'Pagan for 4 nights in July 2011 to celebrate my daughters 21st birthday. We had 2 rooms between the 5 of us,both were beautiful and spotlessly clean.The breakfast was very good and it was lovely sitting in the small courtyard.Lorna on reception was very,very useful and mapped out our days for us.We went to St Marks Square,which is a mass of scaffolding and bill boards but you only had to walk 50 yards and you were in the true Venice.As people have said before,wander along the lanes,get lost and keep away from the masses! A private water taxi is a "must",great fun! Thankyou for a brilliant stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place, nice people and lovely themed bedrooms”
Reviews.Author: teamhughesitaly
Reviews.Content: arrive by train from Rome, 3 hours then grab a water taxi to the hotel, very easy

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel In a Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Matthew R
Reviews.Content: If you can navigate the public water boat system, this is very close to the San Samuel stop, only two from Rialto , which is connected to the Alilaguna system from the airport. Knowing this will save you some dough and get you to your hotel fairly easily. The hotel itself is nice; a little pricey, but this is to be expected in Venice during the summer. Great location; within walking distance to many of the main touristy areas. Breakfast was nice, and the staff were all very friendly. One of the women working there was from Britain originally, which made getting directions much easier.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel if you don't need a pool or fitness center”
Reviews.Author: MikeDigor
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Very good rooms combined with convenient location. Family run business, service is very warm. Every advice by Lona was useful and we do appreciate her efforts to make our vacation as good as possible. No regrets we stayed there!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended - Great Service”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyM815
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend - now finance - were here just a few days ago. It is extremely conveniently located, and the rooms were very nice. We had no issues with noise, etc, as the walls seem quite thick, as are the doors, and the area is just not overrun with tourists. Lorna, the lovely vivacious British expat at the front desk was an absolute gem. I can't say enough about how much easier she made our trip. We'd never been to Venice before and her guidance was invaluable. We're very grateful to her and I hope the hotel takes good care of her, as due to her service, we'd come back in a heartbeat. The breakfasts were simple, but good, and the other staff was very gracious, genuine, and accommodating. I really don't have any complaints...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Much2bdun
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this wonderful hotel. The location was easy to get to - just a few steps from the San Samuele water taxi stop off the Grand Canal. The area in which the hotel is located is quiet and away from the strange odors that sometimes eminate from the canal. It was in close proximity to everything including the charming Campo Santo Stefano where several terrific restaurants are located. The room was on the small side, however, it was clean and beautifully decorated. Lorna was amazing! She provided invaluable advice on where to eat, shop for souvenirs and places that shouldn't be missed while in Venice. I couldn't be happier with this hidden gem that we were fortunate enough to find!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: gill3sq
Reviews.Content: Ca Pagan is brilliantly situated right next to a water bus stop - so easy to locate! Quiet little street full of arty shops, leading to San Stefano square with great cafes - particularly Le Cafe. Easy walk to all main sights, we loved it. Very clean and professionally run - Lorna was a font of all knowledge! Only slight criticism - breakfast bread was not fresh enough to eat but the rest of breakfast was excellent. Many thanks,

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: Sharonwhite08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Ca' Pagan during our honeymoon in April 2011. It is a small hotel but the location is great, just yards away from a water bus stop. The service is amazing. They upgraded our room for free. We slept in one day, and they called to wake us to make sure we got some breakfast before they closed the kitchen. I felt like I was at home! The british woman at the front desk is wonderful and goes out of her way to accommodate you. It was a wonderful experience and I highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ziggie123
Reviews.Content: Venice was the third stop on our trip to Italy and the Ca' pagan was the perfect place to stay. It is a small charming hotel that is not only easy to reach from the train station but also close to all of the major attractions. The owners and staff were friendly and went out of their way to make sure we enjoyed our stay. Lorna at the front desk was particularly helpful and made sure we had plenty of things to see and do during our short stay.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel1725
Reviews.Content: My husband and I truly enjoyed our stay at Ca Pagan. The service and rooms were impeccable. And Lorna, the British madam who runs the hotel is absolutely the best...so kind and helpful. The hotel is very easy to find off the the San Samuelle vaporetto stop. My one minor suggestion for the hotel is to put a mirror in the bedroom. Ca Pagan is a great hotel and I would recommend it to anyone who is lucky enough to visit Venice. The city is amazing!!

Reviews.Title: “BEST PLACE TO STAY IN VENICE !!!!”
Reviews.Author: maria_polano
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Venice 3 times in the last 4 years. This year we found this beautiful hotel that was in the best location! The water taxi drops you off practically at the door which is the first plus-the hotels furnishing, decor, comfort , continental breakfast etc.. were superb! We found this place because of the reveiws and if you read them you will hear wonderful things about the owners and the staff-well it's all TRUE!!! They really do make your stay more enjoyable! They are adding more rooms and suites and we can't wait to return. If you enjoy wonderful service, beautiful accomodations,and are looking for a great location then you have found the right place!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and cute little B&B”
Reviews.Author: timmttx
Reviews.Content: The Ca' Pagan is a 4-story building with the top 2 floors being used for apartments and the lower 2 floors serving as a Bed & Breakfast. The first floor consists of a small entry lobby and a room used to serve breakfast. All of the guests rooms are located on the 2nd floor. The Ca' Pagan is located a short walk from the Grande Canal. It is next door to the Palazzo Grassi, a museum which reopens 2 June 2011. Getting around is easy in Venice (if you don't mind walking). The Ca' Pagan is near Vaporetto stop San Samuele (line 2), Sant'Angelo (line 1). If you ask for directions to the Traghetto, you can cross the Grande Canal for â‚¬0,50 per person. A short walk from the Ca' Pagan is Campo San Stefano, a little small open area with several restaurants, a drugstore, a flower shop, and a couple of cafes. From there it's another 10 minute's walk to San Marco Square. The staff (2 + the owners) were terrific. They both really went out of their way to be helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you have read is true!”
Reviews.Author: RustyDusty1000
Reviews.Content: There is little for me to add. The location is fantastic, close to everything (including water bus stops) but extremely quiet. The room and bed were very comfortable and the gudance as to where to eat and visit in Venice truly first class. Hard to fault at all! If we come back to Venice it will be to this hotel. Minor gripes (very minor) were shower would have benefitted from smaller more modern fittings to enable a normal sized body to fit in more easily, internet is free but one has to get 12 hour access so if you stay several days you have to keep asking and bread at breakfast not great (rest of breakfast very good). I emphasise these are minor gripes this hotel is exceptional!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: alexmontreal71
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Ca'Pagan in Venice. This hotel was very well situated. The rooms were comfortable and beautifully decorated. Above all, the service was outstanding. Thank you, Lorna and Dindo.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Ieda_Correia
Reviews.Content: Ca'Pagan is an excellent hotel. It is a small property (only six rooms) very well and elegantly furnished. Very well located (close to San Samuelle and St. Angelo vaporeto's stops), within 15 minutes walking distance from San Marco's square and close to many other attractions. The staff is which makes it so special. Lorna (the manager) gave us a lot of useful tips and was very helpful every time we needed her. Dindo was helpful either and both of them makes you fell welcome, always smiling and saying nice things. This is the best hotel we have ever stayed at and we definitely recommend such a nice place to stay at to explore Venice, one of the most beautiful cities in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Venice hotel”
Reviews.Author: michelle_wibisono
Reviews.Content: Ca' Pagan is one the of the loveliest hotels around. It is away from the tourist crowds (which means it's quiet), yet very easy to find as it is about 50m from a vaporetto stop. You won't get lost trying to find it. It is close to Campo San Stefano, which has some awesome restaurants. The staff are wonderful, especially Lorna. Using a map of Venice, she drew us a route, highlighting recommended gelaterias, wine bars, cafes, pizza parlours and restaurants. You won't really need your Lonely Planet! We were also treated to freshly cooked breakfasts (which was unexpected but which we definitely enjoyed). The rooms were a good size, very clean and comfortable. It was very reasonably-priced. We will definitely stay here again when in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeahVancouver
Reviews.Content: Ca'Pagan is a lovely boutique hotel - close enough to all Venice sites but a nice break from the hords of tourists. I absolutely loved the decor of the hotel and the big soaker tub! The staff are very attentive and make you feel that Ca'Pagan is a home away from home. It's fantastic value for money in Venice and would highly recommend a stay at Ca'Pagan.

Reviews.Title: “Don't think twice.... just book it, you won't regret it!”
Reviews.Author: nicjames
Reviews.Content: All i have are great things to say about this hotel and i could go on forever, but i won't. Instead ill just list a few: *Lorna - the perfect hostess - this hotel would not be the same without her. Nothing is too much trouble and she goes out of her way, consistently, with every guest. *We stayed in the Cassanova room - beautiful and romantic. Good size for Venice and the most gorgeous double shower with lots of hot water!!! *Location is perfect - 2 min walk to the water taxiis and we walk everywhere in Venice. Nothing more than a 15min walk away. And Lorna maps it all out for you, very easy to follow. *My now finance actually booked this hotel as he proposed to me in the middle of San Marco square on sunset, He had arranged for a bottle of champagne to be in our room when we return from dinner. And there is was on ice waiting for us when we got back, *My final words.... the most quiet hotel room i have EVER stayed in. I was a flight attendant for 10 years and have stayed in my fair share of hotels around the world but this room bets them all..... i literally couldn't hear anyone the entire time i was in the room, not even in the hallway! Ca' Pagan thank you so much for making our stay unforgettable! We will return i promise you that!

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: bedfojo
Reviews.Content: Very good location. Good rooms of a reasonable size (for Venice!). Price reasonable (for Venice over New Year!) Breakfast is fine if unspectacular. Best thing: service is fantastic, with every effort made to be helpful. Great tourist advice and good restaurant recommendations. Issues with the room (turning up the heating, fixing an electrical issue) were solved quickly and efficiently.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and great location.....”
Reviews.Author: Adele819
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ca' Pagan in September 2010 and we had a wonderful experience. We only stayed for one night and we certainly wish we could have stayed longer in Venice. Our train was running late upon arrival causing us to miss our pre-booked tour. We let Lorna know and she did everything in her power to try to get us back on our tour. She was absolutely wonderful in her customer service and she certainly goes above and beyond for the clientele of the hotel. The location is great, not too far from a taxi stop and in easy walking distance with your luggage. We easily walked to all the sights of Venice from our hotel. It was in a less congested area of Venice and that made it nice and quiet, which my husband and I really enjoyed. We also found a local murano jeweler (husband and wife team) right down the street from the hotel and you can find some wonderful pieces of jewelry in there! We enjoyed every minute of our stay and plan to go back one day to Venice and we would love to stay here again. Thanks Lorna for making our stay so wonderful!!!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay close to the Grand Canal and St Mark's”
Reviews.Author: acrrll
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel with about 10 rooms with less than a 5 minute walk from the Grand Canal. Lorna ( the manager) realy made us fee at home. Our room was very spacious and very well kept. The continental breakfast in the morning was great with a very good selection. Dindo was there with freash bread and refills. Lorna lent us an umbrella and told us the best places to go and see. It was a great start to our vacation

Reviews.Title: “Good value - Great service”
Reviews.Author: rovingrebel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend in October with my girlfriend. The receptionist was as good as previous posts suggest. She gave us great advice on restaurants and transport. The rooms were small but well maintained. My one reservation would be that the air conditioning didn't seem to work. We found it warm in October. It could be unbearable in the summer. The hotel had free unlimited wi-fi internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Best and most professional receptionist.”
Reviews.Author: speed98098
Reviews.Content: The receptionist was extremely helpful and friendly. As we checked in, she gave us all the information and guided us where to go and what to do in Venice. She was great.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful Place with the BEST Service”
Reviews.Author: KStarVancouver
Reviews.Content: Lorna is the consummate hostess...we truly had an incredible experience staying at Ca Pagan. Lorna was so warm and welcoming! She provided heartfelt advice on what to do...and more critically...where to eat...in Venice. She made her best efforts to assist us when we had problems with our train tickets. Such a wonderful human being with a heart of gold. She is truly a great asset to the hotel. With respect to the hotel, the location was very convenient with the water taxi so close to the entrance of the hotel. The entrance is subtle...but once you find it, it is easy to find again... Wonderful little shops and galleries in the nearby area. The room was very comfortable and beautifully decorated. (We stayed in the Marco Polo Room.) The service was outstanding...our room was regularly cleaned...the beds were turned down before evening each day... The breakfast was wonderful! A wide range of both savoury and sweet delicacies to choose from. Our morning cappucino ritual was one that I hope to experience again...the staff take pride in making a fine cappucino... We will definitely stay at Ca' Pagan for future visits to Venice... Our one regret for our European adventure was that we did not stay longer...

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, fantastic service, would absolutely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynBruin
Reviews.Content: I found this boutique hotel here on Tripadvisor. All the reviews are correct. The location is choice and the service (especially the front desk woman) is so fantastic. We took the Eurostar from Florence, walked out of the train terminal to the vaporetto stop, took the no. 2 to the San Samuele stop, walked along the left path about 100 ft or so and saw Ca' Pagan on the left. So convenient and such a welcoming sight in what can be a very confusing city. The front desk woman (man, I feel bad that I forgot her name, but I remember she was British) was super welcoming. She pulled out a map and gave a lot of great recommendations for restaurants and sights to see in the neighborhood. She highlighted all these great spots and we went to 2 of the restaurants she recommended and they were both excellent (Da Fiore and a beccafico). This is when we realized how convenient our hotel was. After this, she asked me to walk around for about an hour and return to the room so she could bring some prosecco on ice for us. It was our honeymoon and this was such a great touch. The room was small, but clean and comfortable. Service, as stated, was very good. We had some coffee in the morning and a pastry as well. The wifi was also included. All in all, I would highly recommend this boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: ms_journo
Reviews.Content: Location: optimal, so easy to reach Rialto or San Marco or the Academia. Vaporetto and water bus (from the airport) 5 min far. Staff: so fridenly and helpful (accurate information for the restaurants, travelling advises with schedules on demand, facilities to print boarding cards, etc...). Room: Casanova for two days, so sweet (with up to date TV system and frequent cleaning). Very calm: first time in 6 years that I wake up at 9! Last time was in Danieli: would be ridiculous to compare with Ca'Pagan, on one hand you get the spiders (in Danieli, at least spider's web), on the other hand you get a lovely stay. That's all folks.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: KimeD
Reviews.Content: We stayed only 1 night following a 12night cruise but wish we could have stayed longer, A small hotel, perfectly located is a quiet area but a short walk for the sights and sounds of Venice. The hotel is beautifully decorated throughout. Confinental breakfast was included and was excellent, the best coffee I've tasted in a while. The staff where very friendly and helpful, especially Lorna who is a font of information and couldn't have been more helpfull with directions and advice on what to do, see and eat. It's a definate for my next stay in Venice. Don't hesistate, book it!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb, Excellent, makes you smile. Just book it.”
Reviews.Author: FrankSue
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Marie2347 for her review of Ca Pagan, which made me select this hotel. It was just perfect. My wife and I, daughter and son in law stayed there and were very impressed. The staff were the friendliest we encountered in our 4 week trip in Europe. From the time we walked in, we were treated like family. The rooms are exceptional, and breakfast was great. At the time of departure, there was heavy rain. No problem, they supplied umbrellas, for the four of us. While we walked to the Vaparetto in the pouring rain, the staff did 2 trips helping us with our luggage !! We asked for suggestions for an authentic venetian resturant, and after giving us exact directions, and marking it on the map, we arrived at a restaurant out of the way, with not a tourist insight (just us). With out doubt, this was the best meal we had in all of Italy and France. Thank you for a memorable, and perfect stay. We can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirl190735
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights at the Ca'Pagan and it was wonderful.It was our fourth viist to Venice and this hotel proved to be the best we have stayed at.It is a small family run hotel which has been beautifully decorated and is very clean.The location is very good,peaceful but in easy walking distance to main attractions.There are many good restaurants nearby which serve fresh local products.Lorna who works the front desk is amazing,making each person feel special and gives so much energy to giving you a wonderful experience of Venice!We thank other people on trip advisor for their reviews as we would never have found this hotel by ourselves,we will definitely return when we visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic gem in quiet area away from tourists”
Reviews.Author: baseball_dad
Reviews.Content: We just spent a couple nights here and loved it. Mr. Pagan did an elegant restoration of an apartment building to create a boutique hotel with 6 rooms, all on the 2nd floor (1st floor in European terminology.) The ground level floor contains the reception desk, a beautiful lobby and the breakfast area. Each room and the common areas are decorated in a lavish but tasteful "Venetian" style. You really feel like you are in a palace. Lorna at the front desk is British and gives very helpful walking and dining suggestions. Definitely enjoy a meal at the Trattoria da Fiore just down the block. Not cheap, but a special experience. This hotel is only a 10 minute walk from St. Mark's, but its neighborhood is quiet and not overrun with tourists like other parts of Venice. It is also just a few yards away from the San Samuele vaporetto stop and doesn't require crossing any bridges which is nice with luggage.

Reviews.Title: “I really loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sgallogly
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel! We stayed in the Cassanova room and it was the most romantic room i ever saw in my life. The receptionist was great, on the first day showing us where to go and what sites to see. And on out 2nd day we were told that the hotel was organizing a free trip out to the Marino island and did we want to go?!! What more could you ask for?! Wonderful hotel. I felt totally at home there. The only thing i would say is finding your way home at night is a little disorientating due to the alley like streets and its location (its quite a walk too from the centre of town). But apart from that fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “really oustanding staff,quiet and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: silvyireland
Reviews.Content: Really clean and quiet hotel,nice and comfortable rooms, central location,however what really makes it stand out is the staff,so absolutely polite, helpful and professional. They went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable and even prepare us breakfast at 6 as we had to leave early to catch the flight.I would absolutely recommend this hotel and would no doubt stay there again if I went back to Venice.

HotelInfo.Name: Ca' Pagan
HotelInfo.Address: San Marco 3268, 30124 Venice, Italy
